page.title: 11WARRINGTON NEW TOWN
page.content: {Warrington Borough and New Town In 1847 the town was granted the status of a municipal corporation. Ambitious plans were laid for the renewal of the town centre, the Town Hall becoming the administrative centre for the Borough. Plans were also made when Warrington was designated a New Town on 26 April 1968, the headquarters being New Town House. The designated area of the New Town is 18,612 acres, and it is one of three 'partnership' New Towns in the country. The local authorities, Warrington Borough Council and Cheshire County Council, retain their responsibilities for statutory services and consultation takes place amongst all three bodies. Eventually the Borough Council will have to decide whether to assume responsibility for the area.
